item.title: Fly tipping blue sofa mattress, 11th February
item.description:
Please collect the blue sofa/futon mattress outside 2 Lawrence Buildings at junction with Garnham Street.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Garnham Street, Hackney, London

item.title: North bound carriageway haunches poor condition, 11th February
item.description:
Road broken in multiple segments between the railway bridge and the junction for west horndon. Cycling this road has become an obstacle course - the worst part of the road is where cyclists will most likely be. I’ll use my MTB next time so I don’t destroy my road bike wheels.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole, 11th February
item.description:
Deep wide pothole on A13 London Bound as you approach Wennington junction from Lakeside. It is in Lane 1 and is close to the white line adjoining lane 2. It is deep and wide probably about as wide as half a dustbin lid
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A13
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Majority of the north bound carriageway has a range of pot holes ranging over 400m from the mini roundabout, 11th February
item.description:
This array of pot holes has been in this location for over a month. Due to the inclement weather the holes are growing at a rate of knots.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging tree branch, unable to get into my car., 11th February
item.description:
Can the tree be cut by a tree surgeon. It’s over hanging for some time, it hasn’t got many leaves on it now so it will be easy to cut at this time. One branch hits my passengers car window so they cannot exit the car when parked in my private car space. So they get out before I park it. Please can you assess all the trees over hanging on other cars to the left. I could cut it myself but may get into trouble, I’d also need a long extension lead . :) thanks!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chaucer Drive, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Whole roundabout is damaged with potholes, 11th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Homewood Crescent, Chislehurst, Greater London

item.title: Urgent Complaint Regarding Abandoned Street Cleaning, 11th February
item.description:
Subject Urgent Complaint Regarding Abandoned Street Cleaning at Drovers Place / Leo Street SE15 2RR London. Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally report the unacceptable and deteriorating environmental conditions at Drovers Place. For several months—possibly up to a year—the street sweeper has completely stopped servicing this area. As a result, rubbish has accumulated along the pavements and roadside without any form of regular cleaning or maintenance. The situation has now reached a critical point. Waste is scattered everywhere, creating an eyesore and, more importantly, a serious public health concern. The neglected state of the street has turned the area into a breeding ground for rats, cockroaches, and other vermin. Residents are increasingly worried about the spread of disease and the safety of children who live and play nearby. It is both alarming and unacceptable that council tax–paying residents are being left to live in such conditions. Preventative environmental hygiene is far more cost-effective than dealing with the consequences of infestation and illness. If this neglect continues, it will inevitably place additional strain on already overstretched NHS resources—something that could and should be avoided through proper local maintenance and accountability. We deserve clean and safe surroundings. I therefore urge the council to: • Immediately reinstate regular street sweeping services. • Conduct an urgent inspection of the area. • Implement a sustainable cleaning schedule going forward. • Provide residents with a clear explanation for the prolonged absence of service. This matter requires urgent attention. I expect a prompt response outlining the steps that will be taken to resolve this issue without further delay. Yours faithfully, Hygenus Anijah.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Drovers Place, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
